intro: Arnebia euchroma var. grandis, commonly known as the Tibetan rhubarb or Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of southern Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant produces vibrant red roots that have been used traditionally in dyeing and medicinal practices. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value and historical significance make it a notable species in both horticulture and ethnobotany.
